website_summaries.verdict: Premier leather conditioner made by longtime company. Good for restoring bevy of leather goods with smooth finish.
pros: Leather looks like new again after just one application
Returns items to soft, supple texture
cons: Strong acidic smell after first application
Could leave leather much darker and discolored from original shade

customer_reviews.title: Literal boot saver
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING!! I have some Ariat boots that are a few years old. Poor things have never been treated well. Other boot polishes just dulled the scratches out. When I applied this solution, I was pretty skeptical because it looks like hair conditioner, but it is amazing. I bought one for my dad. The picture speaks for itself. (After on the left. Before on the right.)
customer_reviews.author: Gloria

customer_reviews.title: Great for leather purses.
customer_reviews.text: After doing a lot of research, I ended up buying this for my glovetanned leather Coach bags. I have one each brown, taupe and black and this conditioner worked great. It didn't darken or alter any of the leather colors at all, but did make an obvious difference in the softness and suppleness of the leather. It also took out minor scuffs and scratches with a little buffing. The process I used was to spread a thin, even layer all over, wait about ten minutes and then use an old cotton tshirt to work the remaining conditioner into the leather.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: See it for yourself
customer_reviews.text: So I was worried that all the good reviews are fake... but this is truly a wonderful product! Saved my $600 boots and thousand dollar bags. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: X. Li

customer_reviews.title: Love your leather and it will love you back!
customer_reviews.text: I use this on all my leather bags and shoes. First I clean with Bickmore leather conditioner. Let dry and then apply this and buff. The difference is amazing. Leather is supple and conditioned. Cleans oils and grime off purse handles. Doesn't change the color of leather. Vuitton handles really clean up nice and stay soft and protected. This is the only product I trust with my designer bags and shoes. It does take a lot for larger items or leather that hasn't been conditioned in a while. But the price is good and you can always buy more. This is my 15th bottle so far. Definitely should buy this!
customer_reviews.author: ZPTN615Top Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed..
customer_reviews.text: I applied this product to the arm of my oversized lounge chair that I purchased a year ago. My intention was to condition the leather, but this product took some of the color and luster away from the leather. Now one arm is slightly lighter than the other. I used it just as the bottle directed. Needless to say, I am very disappointed....
customer_reviews.author: Betty Ann Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Fraudulent non-disclosure of defective product.  Seriously.  See the photos.
customer_reviews.text: Why did your product description NOT include that the product I received was DAMAGED and "Not for Sale" !? Literally says it right on the container. Wtf? This should probably be disclosed in your product description. So, everyone, be aware of this.
customer_reviews.author: I bought this and wtf?

customer_reviews.title: Came without a cork
customer_reviews.text: Bottle has a sticker saying DAMAGED (not for sale) and does not have a cork. Sending it back
customer_reviews.author: TomH

customer_reviews.title: Why bottle did not come with lid?
customer_reviews.text: This product was not allowed to return, But it came without lid, I just opened it. I need lid, because it will get dry if I open it. Please help
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Chen

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!!-This WILL darken your leather!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use on some leather shoes that belong to my daughter. She was so disappointed to see that her lovely light tan shoes are now brown. If your leather is a very light color, be very careful. Also, this product claims to be a conditioner that also cleans, but it does not clean. only puts on a layer of conditioning.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Brings leather back to life
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe it’s taken me this long to discover this product! Bought the leather conditioner and the spay protectant for a new suede bag and leather riding boots, and decided to try it on my favorite leather clogs that I’ve had forever but haven’t worn because they were...well, worn. The leather conditioner alone made my shoes look brand new! Did one at a time to see the difference...picture speaks a thousand words!
customer_reviews.author: Julie and Ben Parris

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for a good product just read the reviews and they will call out to you "if you buy me, your problems will be gone."
customer_reviews.text: The whole family of products from the cleaner, polish, and sealer are awesome. My leather chairs were a little messed up from dog saliva from my grandparents poodles. So I read all the reviews and figured over 500 people like the product and must be a good product. Well all three of them are and it took the spots that were messed up from the poodles and made it brand-new. So hopefully the sealer which was not on the chair yet will help to protect for the next time. What's the sense of having leather chairs if you don't take care of them.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L.

customer_reviews.title: Almost Magical Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Used this to condition leather on a trio of older flight jackets. Rubbed it in with bare hands, intermittently kneading the leather. The results were astonishing. The leather was noticeably more supple and pliant, softer to the touch, the grain popped and the entire jacket looked rejuvenated. Bick 4 did not darken the leather, was absorbed quickly and left zero residue of any kind. I gave each jacket a quick buff with a soft clean towel. First rate conditioner, the best I've used and I've used a lot of them.
customer_reviews.author: rainguy

customer_reviews.title: Product Sent without cap
customer_reviews.text: How am I supposed to use this product with no cap? Once the seal is open I have no way of closing the bottle. Looked inside bag and nothing was there. Would give this zero stars if possible.
customer_reviews.author: badwolf10

customer_reviews.title: NOT RETURNABLE. RUINS LIGHT LEATHER
customer_reviews.text: This should be negative 100. IT RUINED A PALE YELLOW PURSE. IT DIDN'T CLEAN AT ALL JUST DARKENED THE LEATHER. I AM SHOCKED THAT SOMETHING THAT SHIPS FROM AMAZON IS NOT RETURNABLE.
customer_reviews.author: pn

customer_reviews.title: I am not elated and will continue looking for a better product.
customer_reviews.text: Hello, I guess after reading reviews and that’s how are you based my purchase is seeing what other peoples thoughts are, I was looking for much more results than what I got. I read for some people said it would make black shiny and slippery etc. I’m doing this on leather saddlebags which I wanted them to look nice clean and new. This did not do that and I know I did the correct process. I am not elated and will continue looking for a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W.

customer_reviews.title: Good but Mild Leather Conditioner.
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality leather conditioner that appears to be very gentle on leather. I think the formula is very similar to Venetian Cream but perhaps a little more mild.. less turpentine? I have used the Bick 4 on two pairs of Redwings and the shaft on my Ostrich cowboy boots. Bick 4 didn't appear to darken the leather, which I like, and why I avoid conditioners featuring Mink Oil. In addition to Bick 4, other leather conditioners my shine kit includes are Venetian Cream, Saphir Renovateur, and Leather Honey.. and for my money I'm going to now reach first for the Bick 4 with the understanding that it's very mild and good for conditioning well-taken care of leather.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Seems to have worked fine. I tested a small spot first. Then did all my leather furniture. I have cream colored leather couches. They didn't darken. It is a lighter lotion and absorbed nice into the leather. I will use it again next time I need to condition my couches. Oh...and the 8 ounce bottle was enough for one chair, a small couch and a daybed. I have a little left. My furniture was in decent shape and just starting to show it was dry.
customer_reviews.author: Daisygirl

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: This saved me 10K! Was housesitting and my 120lb Great Dane decided to play on a $10,000 leather couch while I was out. I ordered this with little hope it would fix the scratches on the couch. I swear it looked better than before after being treated with this!! It could NOT have worked any better. I paid for 24 hour delivery but would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Sparkles

customer_reviews.title: Don’t use on white leather
customer_reviews.text: Disclosed white purse to a dingy yellow. Thank god I tested it first.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well, but I'll need 6 months of Summer to know
customer_reviews.text: Used this on the leather upholstery in my truck which sits in a lot of summertime heat and sunlight. I am looking for something to save my leather - it is starting to show wear and crack despite being treated yearly with leather products. It goes on nice - I used a clean lint-less cloth - but I used about half a bottle to complete the cabin of my truck - the bottle will be good for 2 treatments only. It did not darken, nor stain, nor cause any noticeable problems with my leather other then help to hide the cracking.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Alan Koeneke

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Conditioner!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! I bought a leather handbag on clearance and it was a bit dried out. I bought some Bick 4 after reading positive reviews. This product absolutely holds up to the reviews! The Bick 4 restored the leather to a soft, supple, moisturized condition after a few applications! I'm so impressed! The application is easy and it leaves the leather smelling brand new. I would definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bickmore Bick 4 peeled off the leather toes of my new shoes
customer_reviews.text: I wanted protection for the leather on my new expensive Mephisto walking shoes for a trip. The photo was taken while I was on the airplane and shows that the Bick 4 had rubbed off leaving a slightly lighter color of grey, and peeling of the Bick 4. I had expected the Bick 4 to be absorbed by the leather and to condition and protect. Instead it created a coating and was not absorbed. The shoes were not subjected to rain or weather conditions and were worn for only a few hours walking through the airport.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Mac

customer_reviews.title: pretty good but not the best
customer_reviews.text: I used to use honey leather conditioner and decided to give this one a try. It's not bad but it doesn't absorb into the leather as well as honey leather conditioner. I regularly use a leather conditioner on my shoes and car, and I've noticed that this product doesn't absorb as well and will leave more residue. It also doesn't smell as pleasant. Other than that it does what it's supposed to do, but there are definitely better options out there.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan lee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and seems to work great
customer_reviews.text: I never take my Apple Watch off when showering. This was not a problem since it is waterproof and the silicone strap that comes with it doesn't care about water. My new expensive leather strap does however, and it unfortunately turned into a piece of bacon after it got drenched last week :-P Did some research and Bickmore Bick 4 seemed to be one of the best options. Got it and checked it out yesterday. It does indeed work pretty well. I may need to treat it again, but it almost immediately softened the leather strap after applying a couple of coats. Really impressive. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Young Fraa

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product! I have an older leather jacket that ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! I have an older leather jacket that was becoming dry. This Bickmore Conditioner restored it back to it's original glory. It took quite awhile and several coats to apply it evenly, but it worked wonders! I used an old piece of cloth lying about and applied rather liberally as i went, before long the leather began to darken and soften. It was well worth the time and energy and I would recommend this product to anyone that wants to breathe some life into their old leather products!
customer_reviews.author: Trez

customer_reviews.title: good stuff
customer_reviews.text: It works great. I didnt think about a before picture until after i did 1. So u have before and after side by side. I dont use a cloth to apply as directions say. I just rub the stuff all over with my hands. U dont lose a bunch in a rag that way and it goes farther. So, i clean them off (usually just a good dry rag to rub the dust and grime away.) Smear it on. Wait a minute or 2 and then use a rag to wipe off the excess. Easy peasy. Both boots took 15 minutes or less. And those are size 18, mo more than likely yalls will be smaller. 🤷‍♂️ good product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bring the shine and suppleness back to your favorite leather!!
customer_reviews.text: Bickmore 4 goes on smoothly and the leather I treated soaked it up immediately. It goes on easily. Wait 30 minutes and wipe with a soft towel. The treated leather is softer and supal. I used it on my boots, jackets and man bag. I satisfied and will buy more soon. Yes, this the treatment brand you’ll want to use.. I like that it doesn’t darken you leather. It has a nice satin sheen to it. Thanks, Bick and Amazon. Another great purchase
customer_reviews.author: STEPHEN T. WRIGHT

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for dark leathers, but a little wary on the light ones.
customer_reviews.text: Clearly states on the product that it will not darken finished leather. I figured my Ariat Workhog boots were finished leather, but the conditioner effected the color. I tested a small spot at the top first and noticed that it was darker, but didn't mind the slight difference, so I did the entire right shoe. When I set it down next to the left, the color was darker but the little nicks and scratches were also significantly less noticeable. I have another pair of lighter boots but I think I am going to try something different. I also can't use it on my wife's boots.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: My first leather conditioner
customer_reviews.text: Darkens leather upon contact, but lightens up. On unfinished leather (which you're not supposed to use with this), the leather doesn't lighten back up all the way, but does get return of the way back to the original color. This will darken suede, so please don't use it for that. I applied a generous amount of this stuff with my hands and fingers onto all of my leather boots, bags, heels and clothing. The finish does seem to not last very long (maybe a few weeks at most), so I recommend reapplying as often as you need to.
customer_reviews.author: Baile

customer_reviews.title: Won’t darken leather shoes
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great!! It does a great job cleaning. However for really dirty shoes I used griots garage leather cleaner which is made for automobiles primarily but still works on other items. Bickmore spreads easy and does a great job keeping the originally color of the shoe. Jason Markk was another brand I had used originally to clean my leather shoes and it absolutely ruined them. It darken my shoes and then dried them out. DO NOT use Jason Markk! It’s the reason I bought the Buickmore
customer_reviews.author: Marcos

customer_reviews.title: A great multipurpose creme for regular leather maintenance!
customer_reviews.text: This creme has worked wonderfully for maintaining all of my smooth leather shoes and purses! I wouldn’t use it to remove heavy stains or anything (there are better cleaning options), but I find with semi-regular use this creme is all that I need to keep my leather pieces hydrated and protected throughout the season. I live in MN, so my rugged footwear like snow boots, winter booties, and platform wedges still get a waterproof spray before snow falls, but for my flats and heels - this is all that I use.
customer_reviews.author: S. Swan

customer_reviews.title: This is the real deal! Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a nice product! Instant results softening a all leather guitar strap. The stiffness was gone to a great degree right off the bat. I'll apply more in the next day or so and see how it goes but im pretty satisfied at this point! A word of caution.. This stuff smells really bad upon application and i was furious! Thinking I'd ruined the strap and eliminated that great leather scent but to my surprise it drys scent free! 👍 It also left no change or discoloration at all but your milage may vary. Test a spot first! This appears to be the real deal and ive got a ton left.... On to the boots! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DozaTop Contributor: Ukuleles

customer_reviews.title: Simply Great
customer_reviews.text: I figured I'd give this stuff a shot. At worst, I'd only be out a few bucks. Worked like a charm, even better than I'd hoped. It not only restored the original look of the leather, but it did not change its color or the patina at all. It even restored the areas that had suffered fairly heavy scratches and other damage. I am seriously impressed with the product. I did a side-by-side of my shoes--one treated and the other without. Unfortunately amazon is being a bit buggy and it won't upload. Maybe I'll try again later.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Magical bottle
customer_reviews.text: So my husband the great he is, did a really dumb thing - Left his boots outside!! They got wet, dirty and faded.. With just one coat they look a lot better. I haven't applied another coat cause well he can do it 😄 He did apply a coat on his work boots and they looked brand new. That's probably cause he takes care of those... Men. I didnt give it any Stars on being waterproof cause that hasnt been tested, but I bet my husband will once again forget them outside & that theory will be tested.. Anywoodles I will like this and will order more if need be, which ha who am I kidding I WILL...
customer_reviews.author: Penny B

customer_reviews.title: Purse Saver
customer_reviews.text: Some dye from my jean jacket transferred to my white Dooney and Bourke purse and I was heartbroken. I thought it would never come out. I tried this on the purse and the dye came out immediately! I couldn't be happier. You can't tell where the dye had stained the purse.
customer_reviews.author: K. Key

customer_reviews.title: The best ot there
customer_reviews.text: I use this with bick 1 leather cleaner on my custom boots and will never use anything els. I've worn custom boots all my life and trust this product. To all the people with negative reviews saying this product has Ruined there leather. You have to have some understanding of leather not swade or rough out lether and the way it work. You have to clean it before conditioning. The conditioner will seem to darken the lether because your adding moisture to it. It will lighten up the next day or two. But not back to the original color. There are Tutorials you can watch on cleaning and conditioning lether.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Cockerell

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with results
customer_reviews.text: Works really well! Helped renew the shine to my boots and get rid of the dryness. No discoloration either. The boot on the left is before and the boot on the right is after one application of the conditioner. I went ahead and did a second coat later which helped any remaining dryness. I've had these boots for about 2 years and hadn't done any conditioning to them (shame on me). I wish I had started using this conditioner sooner. I'm sure if I had done regular treatments to them they would still look brand new. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon B.

customer_reviews.title: Renewed my shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly I've never used any leather conditioners prior to purchasing Bick 4 so I am not the expert here, BUT the product did exactly what was described. It worked really well for what I wanted, smoothed out the minor scuffs without darkening the color. Both shoes are full grain leather and the shoe beside the Bick bottle was conditioned while the other was not. The last photo is how it appears during the application (before drying) it may appear slightly darker, but it's actually the original color of that shoe (2 years of wear and tear). If I had major scuffs I'd likely use a different product, but overall I am happy with the product and would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Krysten

customer_reviews.title: Superior leather conditioner.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried my fair share of leather conditioners and this is quickly becoming my favorite. Although it takes more product than I anticipated to condition my boots, it soaks in and leaves the leather looking healthier than it looked brand new out of the box. Not the greatest at waterproofing but there are a number of other products that I would use for weather proofing the welt area. I already have the larger size bottle waiting in my cart for next time.
customer_reviews.author: chris van over

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a cleaner/conditioner combo for my steel toe Dr. Martins. I work at Starbucks on the weekends and my shoes get covered in coffee, syrup, sauces, dish water, the whole works. In my attached photos you can see before and after photos. This stuff is seriously amazing. There is no harsh chemical smell either, a huge bonus! I bought a soft bristle brush to use with this also from amazon and it’s amazing. You won’t regret this!
customer_reviews.author: Kylie Marino

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic to restore old leather goods
customer_reviews.text: My husband's "purse" is an old Lands End leather backpack that is about 17 years old. It was starting to look a bit shabby. I used 3 other products in it with little effect til this one. I wound up using two heavy coats, applied with my fingers, and each time allowed plenty of time for them to soak in. Now the backpack looks 10-12 years NEWER. It darkened slightly but I think it looks better that way. The wear had created some light areas. Buy it. Use it. Be happy!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Good for dog leash and harness care
customer_reviews.text: Bick 4 product was specifically recommended for the care of the leather harness and lead used by a family members service dog. It’s supposed to help condition and protect the leather so it doesn’t dry out and crack with use everyday over the years. The bottle has a seal under the cap that has to be removed prior to use and directions are easy to follow. Had no problem using on black latigo or brown English saddle leather. There was no or very little scent noticed.
customer_reviews.author: Barking HawkTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: this stuff works very well!
customer_reviews.text: I have a few pairs of real leather clogs. I've used other leather condtioners in the past and they didn't work to well bringing the leather back to being flexible and pliable. So I had to get a new pair which I did, the leather is tight and unforgiving. After the reviews, I went with Bickmore. After a few treatments of this on the leather, the leather is now softened up enough for me to wear. This conditioner has worked very well for me and I'm going to keep up with it and see what happens in the future!
customer_reviews.author: EricF

customer_reviews.title: It has its own smell that I find fairly light (it smells a bit like Elmer's glue to me)
customer_reviews.text: I've used this leather conditioner on some old briefcases and some saddle shoes that I have. It's not greasy, seems to soak in well, and hasn't changed the color of anything that I've put it on. It has its own smell that I find fairly light (it smells a bit like Elmer's glue to me); however, whenever I put it on a piece of leather, it just seems to intensify the smell of that particular item, and the Elmer's glue smell seems to go away entirely.
customer_reviews.author: heydudeitsme

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastic!! Use with Bick 1 if the leather is really dirty!
customer_reviews.text: Does a fantastic job. Use with the Bick 1 if the leather is dirty and between the Bick 1 then the Bick 4 your leather really does come out looking great. I initially bought it to clean a leather watch band for a watch I had purchased used. The watch band was really dirty from repeated wear. So my expectations were low and Bick 4 worked great after initially pretreating it with Bick 1 bc the leather was so dirty. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Leather Conditioner!!
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing some desert boots, i noticed that despite me using there waterproofing wax, and one day i started noticing the leather drying out. Therefore i was looking for some conditioner to soften the leather and found Bickmore on Amazon. There were others available, but i wanted to try this out because its made in the United States of America. After using this conditioner i must admit that im extremely happy with my purchase. Not only did it soften the leather, but it still soft a few days later. I would definately reccommend this to my friends and family or anyone who's looking to condition there leather boots. Thank you Bickmore for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: David Smith

customer_reviews.title: Moisturizes well
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to moisturize my Dr. Martens from the inside out to.soften them to break them in. I dodmt want to darken them,(purple and blue), so I used Bick4 on the inside and Saphire cream polish on the outside. I used Bick 4 every other day for a week, them a couple days the second week. It worked, no blisters. I have purses, saddles,.bridles and boots that I want to try it on now.
customer_reviews.author: TJTB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Leather Conditioner!
customer_reviews.text: I took a pair of beloved and very expensive leather boots out of storage for fall and winter wear and they were ashy colored,dry and stiff. I ordered this conditioner based on the reviews and am very happy with the results. I rubbed it into a small area to test as recommended, and it was safe so I used it liberally all over both boots. They are now buttery soft and smooth and the colors are all as rich as the first day I bought them. Beautiful results! No odor! Will use on all my leather items and would definitely recommend to others!
customer_reviews.author: SphynxxMomm

customer_reviews.title: I made a GREAT CHOICE,YOU SHOULD TOO!
customer_reviews.text: I was advised by Relentless Tactical to purchase Bickmore Bick 4 leather conditioner to help with a very stiff holster.I did use it to put on three light coats on the holster and it was like MAGIC.This is some good stuff and it is not pricey,I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT.
customer_reviews.author: Old Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Lovely Conditioner; Doesn't Darken Leather
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to conditioner for all of my boots, especially since lexol changed their production. Bick 4 is easy to apply, conditions leather very nicely, and most importantly hardly effects the color of my leather shoes. While there are more expensive conditioners out there, Bick 4 is definitely the most budget and color friendly option around that I'd trust for use on my shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrett

customer_reviews.title: Look no Further---You Found it!
customer_reviews.text: As another reviewer once said this is the best when it comes to leather conditioning. I have other leather cleaners but they did not penetrate and leave such a soft velour type surface on the leather. One gets the impression this leather conditioner really conditions and not just shines on the exterior. Leave a glossy finish but more importantly a soft leather feel that is a remarkable difference on smooth leather (bonded leather in my experience).
customer_reviews.author: Jan Michael Nace

customer_reviews.title: works like it says
customer_reviews.text: i have used this for reconditioning leather that i have washed. it's better than using products meant for shoes as it seems to replenish moisture better, absorbs faster, has a pleasant smell that dissipates after a while and doesn't appear to change the color of leather. i've used it on the black leather trim of designer jeans and on a pair of white leather pants resulting in softer garments. very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Great product for leather car seats!
customer_reviews.text: I got the package really late, about one month since I placed the order, this was due an error from a courier, finally, I tracked down the package and got it! The product is amazin, I, myself, I am kind of a car leather weirdo when it comes to my BMW leather seats. Over the years I tried many products that, somehow, were satisfying but not like this product. The leather feels hidrated and there is no particular scent that remains in the car.
customer_reviews.author: Cosmin R

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for high-end bags and shoes
customer_reviews.text: Did an excellent job on my high-end bags and shoes. Smells like vinegar out of the bottle but no lingering smell on leather items. Also as advertised, it did not darken lighter colored leathers.
customer_reviews.author: fres

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: My fathers leather coat was "coated!" in nicotine dust. (A brown, spider webby, nasty substance. He has smoked in the house for the past 45 years, and left his coat uncovered. After using this product, the coat is back to it's former glory (or damn close!!). SO SOFT! (PS. After cleaning, I put the jacket in the trunk of my car with 1/2 a container of Snuggle vanilla/lilac softener sheets to get ride of the smell.)
customer_reviews.author: donna

customer_reviews.title: This One
customer_reviews.text: I've tried most easily available leather conditioners on the market, from tack stores, auto supply chains, and big box stores, and a lot of them are very good. This is better. Hands down the most conditioning leather conditioner I've ever used. From saddles to car seats to vintage designer bag rehab, this is the only conditioner I want. Everything else is an also-ran.
customer_reviews.author: ecf2xtreme

customer_reviews.title: Will darken your vachetta leather a lot!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Comparing this to the Cadullac leather lotion, this conditioner significantly darken the vachetta leather on my LV bag without giving it the same shine that the Cadillac lotion does. Not very happy how it turned out. The leather went from lightly patina to looking dark brown.
customer_reviews.author: H-L-

customer_reviews.title: Had no idea how stiff my shoes were
customer_reviews.text: Just used this for the first time on my dried out leather shoes. Absolutely love it! I ended up applying two coats to my shoes as they were so dry and they turned out amazing. I can’t believe how stiff the leather was before I applied it. Both applications, I let it sit and soak in and they turned out excellent! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Hardee

customer_reviews.title: Works Like Magic!
customer_reviews.text: This product has no noticeable odor and isn't sticky or oily or runny. It's like magic and worked very well. Just two coats was all I needed for a pair of leathers. I wish I found out about this product sooner, my mom chucked her leather sofa a few years back :O It's so easy to use I almost feel guilty! Ok I said almost!
customer_reviews.author: SN

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and works wonders
customer_reviews.text: This is the first leather conditioner i have used so I don't have a comparison point for it but this stuff is great. I had some shoes that were in need of some TLC. After cleaning them up and adding this conditioner the shoes look better than the day I got them. Once the cream and polish was added they were better than ever. The conditioner softens the leather a bit so the fit better too. Love this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Jayson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for finished, smooth top leather.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is impressive. I have used Leather Honey for years, and while the LH is great foe restoring very dry, cracked leather, the Bick 4 is superior for routine maintenance. It darkens less and is much easier to apply than the LH. I just used this on two pairs of Fry boots, one pair of Ariats, and two Ekornes leather chairs...the results on all were superb. I recommend this for routine maintenance, and the LH for restoration.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gleeson

customer_reviews.title: The best leather conditioner around
customer_reviews.text: Just go ahead and buy this stuff right now. It is absolutely incredible for cleaning and conditioning leather. I've used this on all of my leather shoes, but especially on my Red Wing boots and it does wonders. Even took out some huge scrapes I had in my boots from a fall. Doesn't change the color of the leather either, which I really appreciate. Great stuff.
customer_reviews.author: butler_ke

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works well to clean and protect leather.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I am very happy with Bick 4 Leather Conditioner. I used this on my leather wallet and it removed the dirt and grime very easily. Only complaints are the odor and the residue it leaves behind. I would say the smell take about 3-4 days to subside and the gritty feeling is gone in a day or two. 5 Stars otherwise! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: EDominguez

customer_reviews.title: this stuff is excellent
customer_reviews.text: I am not real hard on my boots so treatment doesn't have to be bullet proof. I have tried lots of oils creams over the years and really I mainly used Saddle Soap until I found this. Now I like this as long as my boot is clean. I don't like anything that discolors the leather. Redwing has a creme that is pretty good and doesn't darken the leather but I don't like it as much as this. On top of all that it is cheap.
customer_reviews.author: scotth

customer_reviews.title: Awesome results
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Brickmore Brick 4 leather cleaner and conditioner to clean and condition my very expensive leather tote. I was nervous about choosing the right one. I read quite a few reviews for different products before choosing the Brickmore Brick 4. I was worried about it darkening the leather. I tried it on a small patch on the bottom. I was extremely happy with the results so I proceeded to clean and condition the rest of the bag. It enriched the leather and left it feeling buttery soft. I'll be using it on some of my other leather items.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Softer leather, no smell after it dries, works great
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a leather dog collar from Etsy that this made much softer, making my dog more comfortable and making it much easier for me to get on and off him. It also made a very stiff new leather belt much softer and easier to work with. It's exactly what I needed, and I can't wait to apply this to some of my other leather items. There is a very light smell when you initially apply it, but it disappears when it's dry (which doesn't take long, maybe a minute or two).
customer_reviews.author: Sarah B

customer_reviews.title: Easy to apply and really works
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product over the last 6 months several times on my shoes. It really brings a nice shine back to them and is very water resistant. I can state this with assurance, because I live in Oregon and it rains frequently here. This is a great product that really works well. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fiore

customer_reviews.title: Bottled Magic
customer_reviews.text: When I'm not immersed up to my eyeballs in e-commerce I refurbish high-end designer handbags. That being said, I'm really selective with what products I use on my bags. Before now I swore by Chamberlains products but after extensive research I decided to give Bick a go. Although I personally don't enjoy the smell if this conditioner that can be forgiven after seeing the transformative results! I've attached a picture of a Balenciaga strap that looked like a goner as well as after 3 back to back applications of Bick's conditioner. I'll let the photos speak for themselves. Do they sell this stuff by the gallon?
customer_reviews.author: Lace Up Lj

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in product
customer_reviews.text: It did nothing for my leather. I couldn't even tell I put anything on it. I had to practically use the whole bottle for one chair and I saw nothing. I could have wiped it down with a soft Rag and it would have done the same thing. So disappointed. I returned it. Plus, it comes in a very small bottle. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Js

customer_reviews.title: Show ya leather some love
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my Ariat boots. I bought my Ariat boots from eBay and noticed that they were pretty dry and had probably been sitting in a warehouse for a very long time. Since I only wore them twice and they didn't get dirty. I skipped straight to step 4 to condition. I'm thinking this will bring some needed oils back in the leather They look better already. Big difference was working conditioner into fine cracks with a soft bristle toothbrush!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, not too messy, did the job.
customer_reviews.text: Moistened and cleaned up my knee-length leather coat. Plenty left in the bottle for a few more treatments. Doesn't smell funny or leave a residue. The leather soaks it right up. The coat felt softer and looked darker and "newer" after I used the product. Helped me ease my worries that I had been neglecting the care of my leather coat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use with great results.
customer_reviews.text: Best conditioner that I've used. Made my old cowboy boots look almost new, made leather shine and supple. Also used on a leather duffle bag that was starting to get stiff and hard feeling. Looks absolutely new and it is softer and more supple then ever. I'm very happing with very easy to use conditioner and plan to purchase more as needed
customer_reviews.author: dab92376

customer_reviews.title: Works as Described
customer_reviews.text: The product is "almost" a gel, thick but easily pliable and soaks into leather at stitches and seams as well.. Bottle is small and I used the product on a one time worn pair of Lowa hiking boots to protect the leather as recommended by the boot manufacturer. From this small bottle, I hope to get 2, perhaps 3 applications on these high top leather hiking boots. Delivery was fast as promised.
customer_reviews.author: PennyLane

customer_reviews.title: Thankfully it did not disappoint. Used on a west elm Hamilton sofa and ...
customer_reviews.text: Looked at a lot of reviews of various products and settled on this. Thankfully it did not disappoint. Used on a west elm Hamilton sofa and it did a fantastic job. Easy to apply, my leather was thirsty! Much healthier look and softer and more even appearance. No residue which I had read in other reviews but didn’t believe. Believe!!! Great product. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: bafreed

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work pretty well. You really have to work it in. My boots are about 5 years old and I've never conditioned them so I ended up having to make multiple applications. It did darken my boots a bit but I think that was probably since they were pretty dry. I've also noticed that they now seem to scuff more easily but the scuffs also are now easier to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Hoogman

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is different from other leather lotions
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after my brother recommended it. I have tried several leather lotions. This one is thinner, which made me think that maybe it wouldn't work as well. But after using it on a couple of pairs of shoes, I can see that it works well and leaves the leather very soft, in addition to removing scuffs. It also doesn't seem to strip color like other lotions, by looking at the cloth after I use it. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben

customer_reviews.title: The best product for boots.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for leather boots. There's nothing better, and it's extremely easy to use. It's not as creamy as saddle soap, and not as oily as neatsfoot oil. You just sort of pour it on, rub it around, and the leather soaks it up. No rags - no wet sponges - no wiping off - no nothin'. If your leather is dry, it refreshes it. The end result is soft leather, and it makes even old boots look a lot newer. I do believe it darkens your leather a bit, but who cares if it makes your boots last longer?
customer_reviews.author: Ike Snopes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to apply and makes your leather look like new!
customer_reviews.text: I used this conditioner on an old pair of leather shoes. Application was easy, the product was like a lotion with no distinct odor. After application and once dry, the shoes looked practically new. I would recommend this product. In hindsight, I should have purchased the larger bottle. 2oz will not last long if you oil your shoes regularly (or have multiple pairs of leather shoes).
customer_reviews.author: J. Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Great Stuff At a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: An excellent leather conditioner! I got a wonderful low shine on my navy AE park avenues just by using this stuff. Smells a good bit like vinegar so make sure you do it in a place that's airy but it does a really great job of hydrating shoes. Much cheaper than getting things like Saphir Renovateur, to boot.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda G. Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and just as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Highly recommended! I have a pair of 30 year old Nocona western boots that have been resoled twice. I have not worn them in a while and decided I'd like to clean them up. They are made of harness leather and have no polish on them and were in pitiful condition. This stuff brought them back to nearly new condition. Amazed me to be honest!
customer_reviews.author: Speed_ Shot

customer_reviews.title: Happy with product!
customer_reviews.text: Imagine hair conditioner or body lotion, it soaked right into our leather sofa making it look like the day we bought it. Not oily, and dries even with uneven application. It doesn’t repair mars, but made them less noticible. One bottle did my whole sofa, with some left over. Note, our sofa is a stained, unpainted leather, which makes a big differences.
customer_reviews.author: sweetpotato

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Worked on my black, brown, and cognac riding boots. Somehow brought back the depth of color and shine in each pair, without changing the boot's actual color. For example, my cognac boots had gotten worn around the heel, and the color was starting to come off around that area. This conditioner restored that area to its original color, matching the rest of the boot. Magic. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Cleans and conditions leather well
customer_reviews.text: I use this to clean and condition my leather shoes/boots. It seems to do a very good job. I like it because it is a simple and quick way of maintaining leather. It will make lighter leathers a bit darker at first, though I honestly think it gives them a richer look. I have a couple pairs of boots that I have been using this on for years, and they still look amazing. I have also used it on work boots, which are used and abused until their destruction, and this seems to stretch out their usable lives.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: My boots look great!
customer_reviews.text: This conditioner works great! My Ariats look better now than they did when I got them! I ended up using three coats because of how dry they were. The photos are before, one coat (on one boot,) two coats, and then the final coat. I used waterproofing spray after they dried. I’m very happy with the results and I will buy this conditioner again.
customer_reviews.author: Katie T.

customer_reviews.title: Made my wife's new boots hazy and flat.  Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what I did wrong, as I've never had an issue with conditioner before, but after getting this stuff on recommendation from a great company, I tried this on my wife's new Ariat Heritage boots. Well, it looked good till it dried and I tried to buff. It looks horrible and flat and like I took an eraser to the boot or something. Not sure how to actually fix the problem this bad product created!
customer_reviews.author: Becles

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works very well. I was brought up on saddle soap and neatsfoot oil. I have not used much else, but this works very well to condition purses without leaving greasy residue. Without knowing what some of the competition is like I would say this is pretty darn good. I liked it enough to buy another product from the company.
customer_reviews.author: Sandal

customer_reviews.title: Good Leather Conditioner (It WILL Darken Most Leathers)
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy this product, but be aware that it will most likely darken your leather. It’s not a bad thing, because you are giving your leather ingredients that will help maintain the longevity of your leather goods. Yet, stating it won’t darken your leather is false advertising.
customer_reviews.author: BAE

customer_reviews.title: Does not improve anything.
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work. I agree with some of the other reviews saying that it looks good (but not great) the second you put it on, but after 10 second it dries and it’s like you didn’t put anything one. The only saving grace is that it didn’t damage the leather. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Big Ears

customer_reviews.title: It will darken scuffs
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice lotion that won't darken TREATED leather, as they say. If you scuff your shoes, though, that scuffed area will darken to darker than the treated/outer layer of leather.
customer_reviews.author: Calibou

customer_reviews.title: Louis Vuitton
customer_reviews.text: I don’t write reviews unless something is absolutely the worst or the best thing ever. In this case I think it’s the best thing ever! It completely revived my 20 year old Louis Vuitton’s leather. After a couple applications it looked shiny and amazing all over again. It evened out some of the discoloration and scratches and didn’t really make it any notíciele darker. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DarrelM

customer_reviews.title: My favorite leather conditioner
customer_reviews.text: I scrub down my boots a few times a year using this product. It seems to work really well and I’ve stuck with it over the last five years. The only other thing that I used as a waterproof once a year for extra integrity and my boots are holding up and looking great!
customer_reviews.author: Momma of 5

customer_reviews.title: Great leather cleaner
customer_reviews.text: I bought a leather pocketbook online and it had a terrible smell. I checked the reviews and one said she used a leather cleaner and conditioner. Google said that leather sometimes carries a bad smell. I used this product as soon as it arrived and NO MORE SMELL!!! It works great
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Tricardo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I used these to recondition my boat shoes after washing them. The leather took up the conditioner nicely and one application after washing the shoes was enough to restore the original look. I like this product specifically because it does not change the color of the leather. Recently, I also tried these on a pair of dress shoes that I had already recently used black polish on. The conditioner shined up the shoes very nicely and gave an overall even appearance with just one application and minimal buffing. I will always keep a container of this on hand from now on.
customer_reviews.author: stamnj

customer_reviews.title: this works on ANY leather
customer_reviews.text: I used this on all my traditional boots and even exotic leathers. It leaves NO residue--no smell, and does not leave a mess or stain your boots at all. I'd say aside from it's natural benefit in conditioning leathers, this DOES NOT ALTER COLOR which is just...superb.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Keep it new
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on my leather jacket. It takes a lot of punishment for the elements and the occasional insect collision. It brought my dry leather back to a new jacket look and feel with just a little bit of the product. 9 bucks well spent to keep my $300 investment like new.
customer_reviews.author: Jostaff

customer_reviews.title: Great for some relatively high dollar shoes
customer_reviews.text: I broke down and got some relatively high dollar outdoorsy shoes, which are a rough leather. Not good for shining, but definitely still need to be conditioned. This bottle should last for a long time, since it just takes a little to condition the leather.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Crabtree

customer_reviews.title: Great leather cleaner/conditioner
customer_reviews.text: Used to clean and condition my leather jacket. It had acquired some mildew and odor. After following a variety of cleaning techniques on the internet which worked well, I decided to do the final step with this Bickmore Bick 4 Leather conditioner. Worked really well. Will use on my boots next. It is a small bottle but was enough for my jacket and more.
customer_reviews.author: D.C.M.

customer_reviews.title: brings back the luster
customer_reviews.text: Easy to apply and has immediate results. Have used it on a Leather brief case, a jacket and shoes. Wish I had found this years ago - really brings life back to the leather. Thought I was going to have to stop using the old but expensive leather case I had - but it looks "classy" again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Phil

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what went wrong?
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this stuff frequently but my leather couch has just turned to dust. It has cracks and everything. I don't want to blame this product, I guess I just hoped this wouldn't happen if I used this? Maybe it's my fault and I don't realize it but as I stand, this didn't work for what I was trying to do.
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I have a chocolate brown (black, barely brown at all) leather coat from wilsons leather. It was starting to get a little stiff, so after reading some reviews I decided to purchase this. I applied very liberally, massaging the leather using nearly the whole bottle. Some color did come off on the rag i used (white cotton cloth) but i didnt mind, it wasnt a drastic change, just slightly. The leather is so soft now its like wearing a leather blanket. Cant wait for winter now...lol...
customer_reviews.author: James Walker

product_meta.title: Bickmore Bick 4 Leather Conditioner 8 oz - Best Since 1882 - Cleaner & Conditioner - Restore Polish & Protect All Smooth Finished Leathers
feature_bullets: PREMIUM LEATHER CONDITIONER SINCE 1882: Bickmore Bick 4 Leather Conditioner cleans, polishes, and protects all types of leather products such as boots, shoes, jackets, purses, handbags, furniture & upholstery, car interiors, motorcycle seats, equestrian equipment such as saddles and tack, any exotic leather products, and more. Our time tested formula is proven to extend the life of all your most precious leather products.

WILL NOT DARKEN YOUR LEATHER: Unlike most leather conditioners, Bick 4 Leather Conditioner will NOT darken your leather. It’s perfect for restoring old, worn leathers to their original shine, and keeping your new leather products in the same shade that you bought them. Ideal for keeping all smooth and finished leather soft without compromising breathability.

COMPLETELY WAX FREE: Unlike other brands, Bick 4 is a completely wax-free product. This ensures that the leather pores will not seal up, keeping your leather soft and able to breathe. It will not leave any trace of sticky or gummy residue.
SIMPLE ONE STEP APPLICATION PROCESS: Our formula is easy to apply and conditions your favorite leathers with ease. Bickmore Bick 4 is your all-in-one complete leather care product.
MADE IN THE USA: Bickmore is proud to produce all Bick 4 Leather Conditioner in the United States of America.

specifications.OEM Part Number: Bickmore Bick 4 Leather Conditioner 8 oz - Best Since 1882 - Cleaner & Conditioner - Restore Polish & Protect All Smooth Finished Leathers
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,021 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
